Container.Name: Redis
Container.Overview:
Redis is an open source (BSD licensed), in-memory data structure store, used as a database, cache and message broker.
This is a template for the bitnami/redis container, with persistence and the environment variables for password protection. For a detailed description of the container and other available environment variables, visit https://hub.docker.com/r/bitnami/redis/ .
Redis requires it's directories to be owned by 1001:1000. For that : - open an Unraid terminal and execute the following commands (without the quotes and replace /path/to/config and /path/to/data with the paths you define for Config and Data below respectively) - (if the directory doesn't exist yet) copy/paste "mkdir /path/to/config" into the terminal, and hit enter - copy/paste "chown 1001:1000 /path/to/config" into the terminal, and hit enter - (if the directory doesn't exist yet) copy/paste "mkdir /path/to/data" into the terminal, and hit enter - copy/paste "chown 1001:1000 /path/to/data" into the terminal, and hit enter

Config.Name: Password
Config.Description: The password required for applications to access this Redis instance.

Config.Name: Allow Empty Password
Config.Description: In order to allow empty passwords, set this to yes.
